column1: Our local small businesses have a huge impact not only on the individuals they employ but the communities they serve. Thankful my office was able to help Primrose School of Plano acquire the financial relief needed to continue teaching students during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/PTE3tgN2xf

Thanks to #OperationWarpSpeed & scientists researchers & clinical trial participants Pfizer announced their #COVID19 vaccine has proven to be 90% effective. As a result of this private/public partnership Americans will have access to 100 mil doses once approved by @US_FDA. https://t.co/bZxsIjudxV

Pranav Pattatathunaduvil and his team of students at Be the Light Youth are using the money they’ve fundraised through speech and debate events and donating it to local food pantries in need during #COVID19. Thanks Pranav for showing us what it means to be a #HometownHero! https://t.co/v2jjO5o6G4

This past weekend my Congressional Youth Advisory Council met with several different leaders with diverse backgrounds to learn more about the impact of COVID-19. I continue to be impressed with the engagement of these dynamic students. https://t.co/DXtgLReLrL

Since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic I’ve been working for people across Collin County like Beth’s son to make sure they receive their benefits. If you are needing help with a federal agency please contact my office at (972) 202-4150 so we can help in any way we can. https://t.co/OEQusVwQt5

Thank you to @ChaseOaks Church for launching #HereForGood which is spreading hope throughout our neighborhoods and addressing critical issues like food insecurity during the COVID-19 pandemic. These #HometownHeroes are working to ensure no one is left behind. https://t.co/JYmc9Hnxev

COVID-19 has highlighted long-standing inconsistencies in the collection & reporting of health data at all levels of gov. Proud to be joined by @RepShalala to introduce H.R.8444  to help ensure health officials have access to the best info. & data. https://t.co/fqJKEQtcTq

Ensuring workers have the skills and knowledge to obtain jobs in our community is incredibly important especially given the economic setbacks of the COVID-19 pandemic. Thanks to @Toyota for your efforts to improve vocational education in #TX03! https://t.co/SClyjtJq1H

Very proud of Judge @EmilyMiskel who will receive the William H. Rehnquist Award for Judicial Excellence for her efforts to innovate remote trials when the COVID-19 pandemic hit. Job well done!  https://t.co/PfUCKyFlXu

This month I met with small businesses and leaders in the @CityofAnna to discuss ways federal CARES Act funding is helping keep businesses open and providing support to employees impacted by #COVID19. There's much work to be done but we'll overcome this together. https://t.co/i5AUxmBT5X

Enjoyed visiting Acuity TMS of Plano and learning about their innovative treatments for depression and PTSD. I’m thankful my office was able to help keep their doors open during #COVID19 so our local veterans and others can continue receiving the healthcare they deserve. https://t.co/oixUfnvC9T

Thanks @AGFoodPantry for fighting hunger in our community and continuing to provide essential resources during #COVID19! These #HometownHeroes distribute over 30 tons of food every month to Collin County families. To nominate a local hero visit https://t.co/CYKM88NgEl! https://t.co/nBxfH3lyC7

Visited @PlanoFireRescue Station 2 where they shared stories from the frontlines. Our first responders are working hard transporting #COVID19 patients & administering tests. From all of us in Collin County thank you for selfless efforts to help us overcome this pandemic. 🚒 https://t.co/MtGFZ3hFe3

Regularly checking in on our neighbors is vital during these difficult times. Thankfully we have some local students and #HometownHeroes to help with this. Thank you to COVID Check-In who has donated hundreds of care packages to senior living facilities around our community!🛍 https://t.co/aZb0Xor9bp

DYK one blood donation can save up to three lives? As a result of #COVID19 many blood drives were cancelled resulting in a shortage of blood donations across the nation. Thanks to the American @RedCross & @Tacodeli for hosting safe blood drives in our community to help others. https://t.co/Fhr7wpgLgS

Visited @BSWhealth this week & was blown away by the treatment & equipment used to aid in the recovery of #COVID19 patients. Thank you to our #CollinCounty #HealthcareHeroes on the frontlines of this pandemic. Your willingness to put patients above yourself is incredible. https://t.co/nJIYXRUMTq

Welcome home to Plano nurse & #TX03 #HometownHero - Rachel Carmichael! Rachel traveled to the frontlines of NYC to provide #COVID19 aid. Thanks to all the nurses and many others who are protecting the health of others above their own. Nominate a hero at https://t.co/k07heeq9fB. https://t.co/bmtywPzD6N

The Paycheck Protection Program’s application deadline is now August 8 2020. With over 6000 Texas-based businesses already receiving loans I encourage Collin County business impacted by the pandemic to visit the link below to apply for #COVID19 relief. https://t.co/GyoZkE2Ep9

Join me in recognizing @vcont2015 as one of our many local #HometownHeroes during these unprecedented times. Thank you for selflessly helping North Texas Veterans cope with the uncertainty of COVID-19.   To nominate a hometown hero you know visit https://t.co/k07heeq9fB. https://t.co/0w19Ikzf0I
If you need help finding a #COVID19 testing location or if you are looking for more information to help determine if you should be tested visit the @TexasDSHS website here ➡️ https://t.co/IpG5Deh1q4.

Below #Dallas businesses can find information on Dallas Forward – an online resource hub for small and medium-sized businesses in Dallas looking for additional financial resources as a result of #COVID19. https://t.co/U8TNwuJfrF

To help small businesses rebound from the financial impact of #COVID19 @CityofAllenTX announced the Allen Small Business Grants Program. For more information including application and eligibility requirements visit the link below. https://t.co/B7BleA5s31

🚨Attention Frisco Small Businesses🚨  @CityOfFriscoTx has announced the #Frisco Small Business Recovery Grant Program to better assist those who experienced financial hardships due to #COVID19. More information on how to apply can be found below. https://t.co/4btwYiZjuw

It’s important we remain vigilant to reduce the spread of #COVID19. While this is an evolving situation please visit my website for issue-specific alerts for families seniors and veterans as well as @CDCgov recommendations on how to #SlowTheSpread. https://t.co/3pJvuxTg3N

As #COVID19 swept the nation a local group of #HometownHeroes donated $240000 in medical supplies to our healthcare workers on the frontlines. A special thanks to DFWCare for helping our community! To nominate a hero visit https://t.co/k07heeq9fB. https://t.co/xB7vSX1J5x

🚨 Important update for small businesses non-profits and independent contractors in #TX03: @SBAgov #EIDL loan applications are once again open to ALL eligible small business impacted by #COVID19. For more info on how to apply visit the link below. https://t.co/aY6H5Rmdd4

Due to financial hardship caused by #COVID19 @CityofMcKinney has announced the #McKinney Strong Recovery Grant Program for small and home-based businesses. More information including eligibility requirements can be found at the link below. https://t.co/oJPl109cfl

Are you a Plano small business in need of financial assistance? @CityofPlanoTX has announced the CARES Small Business Grant Program to help relieve some of the financial hardships caused by #COVID19. https://t.co/8dfReL2xMJ

When #COVID19 struck Greg Danson of Frisco didn't sit on the sidelines and instead started North Texas Relief to help at-risk neighbors pick up groceries and other supplies. Thankful for everything this #HometownHero has done to help Collin County during these trying times! https://t.co/3QKPY8ctNY

Join me for a telephone town hall starting right now on continuing efforts to combat #COVID19. We’re also answering your questions on the Collin CARES Program which just launched this week. Stream online at https://t.co/DA3KSbD3JT or call (855) 731-4614. https://t.co/BNOKiRID2y

Today I'm hosting another Telephone Town Hall on #COVID19 resources for #TX03 residents. Rep. Shaheen Rep. Leach and Judge Hill will join me to provide information & answer questions on the Collin CARES program. To participate sign up at https://t.co/SJnUKwg0RS. https://t.co/cplaqYqg2d

May is #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth. If you or a loved one are feeling overwhelmed with emotions like sadness or anxiety perhaps as a result of #COVID19 & social distancing @DistressLine is available 24/7 to speak with you. 📞 Call 1-800-985-5990 📱 Text TalkWithUs to 66746 https://t.co/CCbrUZettS

Do you meet @CDCgov criteria for #COVID19 testing? Thanks to @CVSHealth new drive-thru testing locations are available in Plano McKinney and Frisco. Find the location nearest you and make an appointment here: https://t.co/OWHN5rNC4q.
Need information on the resources available to families workers veterans and seniors impacted by #COVID19? Sign up for issue specific alerts now: https://t.co/G2HzSLlxOh. https://t.co/nBTGUhhIWd
Check out the #COVID19 symptom assessment tool and the testing location finder on the @TexasDSHS website. https://t.co/plIyDHQJEm https://t.co/Rfoz32wXTj

Glad to be teaming up with @VANorthTexas to host a #COVID19 Healthcare Webinar for Collin County Veterans this Tuesday. Veterans or their families will be able to participate via telephone or video conference. Visit https://t.co/n7b0DZedaL  or call (972) 202-4150 to RSVP! https://t.co/FaRp9O7eVZ

Excited to team up w/ @CFPB​ for a webinar for those facing financial difficulties as a result of #COVID19. We'll take audience questions & discuss keeping up w/bills forbearance dealing w/ debt student loans & protecting credit. Register at https://t.co/NO83rxk8J1 https://t.co/ymJYpYVWQU
Great bipartisan discussion with @RepColinAllred @GromerJeffers and the Dallas Friday Group about government efforts to combat #COVID19 - especially right here in North Texas. https://t.co/tLD8euTngH

On Wednesday the @USNavy @BlueAngels will fly over the Dallas/Fort Worth region to honor the healthcare & essential workers on the frontlines of the #COVID19 pandemic. While a detailed route will be released tomorrow the flyover will begin at 11 AM & last roughly 35 mins! https://t.co/abTKCQLmad

This past week I hosted another Telephone Town Hall to answer your questions about #COVID19. If you weren’t able to join the call you can listen to a full recording of the event online at https://t.co/6jl7vKhHfU. #TX03 #CollinCounty https://t.co/2DQMYgZQff
Waiting for an Economic Impact Payment? Visit https://t.co/DTpXnNh4tU to learn how to check the status of your payment and update your contact information with the IRS. #COVIDrelief

Today marks the start of Phase 1 of the strategy to safely reopen Texas. Certain services & activities are allowed to open with limited occupancy. Review checklists from @TexasDSHS & be sure to adhere to health protocols to minimize the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/FjYqU74Tsm

I'll be hosting my 6th #COVID19 telephone town hall tonight at 6PM. If you didn't register for the event dial (855) 731-4614 or visit https://t.co/DA3KSbD3JT to join.  Sen. Paxton Rep. Shaheen Judge Hill & medical experts from Collin County will also answer callers questions! https://t.co/IuAu4Crnsr

#COVID19 has seriously disrupted our supply chains. While we increase domestic production efforts it’s imperative we learn from this pandemic. Proud to team up w/ @RepJoeNeguse to introduce H.R. 6641 to create a bipartisan commission to improve the Strategic National Stockpile. https://t.co/LdlPjFUYot

I'm hosting my 6th #COVID19 telephone town hall on Thursday & hope you’ll register. Judge Hill Senator Paxton Representative Shaheen & medical experts from County Department of Public Health will be joining me to answer your questions. Register at https://t.co/XVOfQkGLmt. https://t.co/LU83dw4lH2
To find information about #coronavirus testing and to find a public testing location near you visit https://t.co/plIyDHQJEm. https://t.co/kXczk0zwBo

Tomorrow I'm hosting a telephone town hall with State Representatives Shaheen and Leach as well as experts from @SocialSecurity @AARPTX and @bswhealth to answer #COVID19 questions from Collin County seniors. Register for the event online now! https://t.co/QDyGJi0de8 https://t.co/HjysklYE6v

Enjoyed visiting with future leaders from around Collin County advocating for @UNICEF’s efforts to help children around the globe affected by #COVID19. In this time of adversity I’m encouraged by the compassion displayed by young people throughout our communities. #ForEveryChild https://t.co/p3W8r5pIBB

#TX03 nonprofits & public eligible healthcare providers can now apply for the @FCC #COVID19 Telehealth Program. These funds will help healthcare providers deliver critical telehealth services to their patients. Apply online at https://t.co/DMwA1yKiYJ.
Grateful my cousin was released from the hospital after winning his bout with COVID-19. A happy story in a difficult time.
The @IRSnews and @USTreasury just launched a new tool to help people who normally don’t file taxes register for their stimulus checks. https://t.co/JuxLyghQOH #COVIDrelief

On Monday I'm teaming up with @TXWorkforce & Rep. Shaheen to host a webinar for those who have been laid off furloughed ordered to self-quarantine or are experiencing reduced working hours due to COVID-19. RSVP for the unemployment webinar here: https://t.co/S8eZcxfvIN https://t.co/sSMrBEmuPI

At 3 PM I'll be hosting a LIVE telephone town hall w/ local officials & experts discussing government response to #COVID19. If you didn’t register for the call or are experiencing technical difficulties dial 1-855-731-4614 or participate online at https://t.co/XVOfQkGLmt! https://t.co/bjrtRYc2oM

Tomorrow I'll be joined by Judge Hill State Senator Paxton and State Representative Leach for a telephone town hall on local state and federal efforts to address coronavirus. Register for the event here: https://t.co/MnQdBlflfq https://t.co/zj36peHTOI

Despite the uncertainty of the world around us I was glad to visit with members of my Congressional Youth Advisory Council today and discuss COVID-19. While these students have had their worlds turned upside down hearing from them gives me great hope for the future. https://t.co/YKAiqG7wDy

ICYMI: Judge Hill Reps. Shaheen & Leach joined me this week for a live Telephone Town Hall on local state & federal efforts to combat coronavirus & keep Collin County families healthy. If you missed the call you can listen to the full recording here. https://t.co/aYcTOjWcBn

Small businesses are the drivers of our economy & help make Collin County the amazing community it is today. Let’s support local businesses impacted by #coronavirus by getting it to go ordering online and purchasing gift cards to use later!#SupportYourLocals https://t.co/fTXzpnDWdv

Right now I’m hosting a LIVE telephone town hall event with local officials and health experts discussing local state and federal response efforts to coronavirus. Dial 1-855-731-4614 to join the call or stream the event online at https://t.co/XVOfQkGLmt! https://t.co/z0rIQPvdhe

Don’t miss my telephone town hall with local officials about coronavirus this afternoon at 3:45 PM. Dial 1-855-731-4614 at 3:45 PM to participate in this important conversation or stream it online at https://t.co/XVOfQkGLmt! https://t.co/8m9Mm3uzbh

I’m hosting a #coronavirus telephone town hall tomorrow at 3:45 PM. I’ll be joined by Collin County Judge Hill State Reps Leach & Shaheen & officials from @CollinCountyGov Department of Public Health to provide info & answer questions! Register here: https://t.co/qcOTwqYE01 https://t.co/HW4312NZ8X

To help those impacted by #coronavirus the @IRSnews has moved #TaxDay from April 15th to July 15th giving taxpayers an additional 90 days to file your taxes. That said those who expect a refund should file as soon as possible. MORE INFO: https://t.co/oFHPafkAQB https://t.co/rWN8IQo9KK

Spoke to a #CollinCounty first responder recovering from #coronavirus - he is on the mend and in good spirits. Join me in participating in #SolidarityAt8 to show our appreciation for those who sacrifice their own wellbeing to keep us safe! https://t.co/3kzDGnPAA2

Small businesses in Collin County impacted by #coronavirus can now apply for Economic Injury Disaster Loans from the @SBAgov. Visit https://t.co/5630dyKHw6 for details and additional resources for local businesses. https://t.co/nblcX9KiSd

The #FamiliesFirst Act guarantees paid sick & family leave for workers impacted by #coronavirus helps get nutritious meals to children & seniors and makes sure testing is free for Americans who need it. Learn more: https://t.co/oFHPafkAQB https://t.co/dpJyS1Yln0

ICYMI: @GregAbbott_TX has made the executive decision to close all schools end noncrucial nursing home visits ban dining in restaurants and bars and ban gatherings of more than 10 people. This cautionary step will protect North Texas as we continue fighting #COVID19. https://t.co/6zyjki3D4R

Need additional information on the resources available to businesses individuals and families impacted by #COVID19? Sign up for issue-specific alerts now: https://t.co/G2HzSLlxOh. https://t.co/0giIDjG5di

Proud to support the #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Repsonse Act & grateful it’s on its way to the President’s desk. As our nation continues to combat #COVID19 its important individuals and families have the support needed to stay home care for loved ones and #StopTheSpread. https://t.co/4OdJjQ4sBw

Many employees & businesses across #TX03 are facing negative impacts from #coronavirus. That’s why I voted for the Families First Coronavirus Response Act which includes crucial paid leave provisions for employees. The health of Americans comes first. https://t.co/WGeLfrBqX0

Spent the weekend working with local state and federal officials about quarantine procedures and economic impact on local businesses from #coronavirus. Visit my website for the latest updates and resources as they become available. https://t.co/P16qLPAd3g https://t.co/pkOp1OsBIl

@Plano_Schools are providing free grab-and-go breakfast and lunch for all students across the district during the #coronavirus closure.   Learn more at: https://t.co/tKXPgDsmTs https://t.co/1HMX5taWIP

It’s important Collin County receives the resources needed to keep our residents healthy. Today I sent a letter urging @TexasDSHS to ensure Collin County receives adequate funding from federal resources to effectively combat coronavirus. INFO: https://t.co/gCQIKIKBgi

As the US works to address #COVID19 I will continue engaging w/ local state & federal health officials to keep Americans safe & healthy. For the most up-to-date information on this rapidly evolving situation please visit my website. https://t.co/kpWwycA3nE https://t.co/PLiLVxgNVg

BREAKING: The House just passed bipartisan emergency funding to combat #coronavirus at home & abroad. We're expediting vaccine development expanding testing & ensuring state & local health departments have the resources they need to respond. INFO: https://t.co/zYxdR6rEWr https://t.co/SeTPISLING

Met with @VP Pence & a bipartisan group of Members in the Situation Room at the @WhiteHouse yesterday to discuss federal efforts to stop the spread of #Coronavirus. I will continue to closely monitor this situation and work across the aisle to keep Americans safe and healthy. https://t.co/cKfwY6xNNH
